abstract: In some Gulf states, schools have a surprising problem: To fight against the ubiquity of English while teaching Arab students high-quality Arabic. A university in Milan is going in the other direction, changing its curriculum to teach all its graduate-level courses in English and doing away with instruction in the local students' native Italian.

headline.main: The Push and Pull of Teaching in English
